definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element

to come to understand/to realize/consciousness/awareness/Buddhist enlightenment (Sanskrit: cittotpāda)
to suddenly realize/to suddenly see the light
to come to oneself/to come to realize/to come to see the truth/to wake up to reality

sentences.english: Third, the joint reading of Jones writing changed, but so.
sentences.chinese: 第三，联读悟写，改换门庭。

sentences.english: The government has not yet announced the punishment of Zhang and his company.
sentences.chinese: 政府对张悟本和悟本堂公司的处罚迟迟未至。

sentences.english: Is the Buddha, "Wuzhen Pian" to real achievements, rather than from the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 就是菩萨，《悟真篇》要成就真人，而非自了汉。

sentences.english: To get a clear understanding of oneself needs self-appreciation.
sentences.chinese: 悟透自己，就是要欣赏自己。

sentences.english: Grandpa enjoyed reading and contemplating on his life.
"Awakening"is that the man reveals his ture nature.
sentences.chinese: “悟”就是见性，是人生观和世界观的根本转变。

sentences.english: I immediately comprehended that I should have waved my palm gently (instead of punching heavily) to receive the blessing force from limitless oneness.
sentences.chinese: 我即悟当轻柔摆手，方能领受无限一体之加持力。

sentences.english: Venerable Wuda was a highly respected monk in the imperial court of the Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这本忏文是中国唐朝高僧悟达国师编写的。

sentences.english: So, true to the line you now, the future will certainly true enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 所以要你们现在的行真，将来的悟一定会真。

sentences.english: In the heart of time to get, acquisition of self.
sentences.chinese: 于心中悟得贞静，于行中习得自我。

definition: a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
ancient harp/cf 箜篌, Chinese harp
to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to achieve supreme enlightenment or nirvana (Buddhism)
